texts.value: Catalyzes the conjugation of leukotriene A4 with reduced glutathione (GSH) to form leukotriene C4 with high specificity (PubMed:23409838, PubMed:27365393, PubMed:27791009, PubMed:7937884, PubMed:9153254). Can also catalyze the transfer of a glutathionyl group from glutathione (GSH) to 13(S),14(S)-epoxy-docosahexaenoic acid to form maresin conjugate in tissue regeneration 1 (MCTR1), a bioactive lipid mediator that possess potent anti-inflammatory and proresolving actions (PubMed:27791009)

maximumVelocities.enzyme: enzyme with leukotriene A4 as substrate

texts.value: kcat is 19 sec(-1) with glutathione as substrate (PubMed:27365393). kcat is 105 sec(-1) with leukotriene A4 as substrate (PubMed:27365393).
Homotrimer (PubMed:17632546, PubMed:17632548). Interacts with ALOX5AP and ALOX5 (PubMed:19233132)

Detected in lung, platelets and the myelogenous leukemia cell line KG-1 (at protein level). LTC4S activity is present in eosinophils, basophils, mast cells, certain phagocytic mononuclear cells, endothelial cells, vascular smooth muscle cells and platelets
Phosphorylation at Ser-36 by RPS6KB1 inhibits the leukotriene-C4 synthase activity
LTC4 synthase deficiency is associated with a neurometabolic developmental disorder characterized by muscular hypotonia, psychomotor retardation, failure to thrive, and microcephaly

features.description: Reduced leukotriene-C4 synthase activity by nearly 80%.
Does not affect leukotriene-C4 synthase activity but substantially increased KM for GSH.

Reduces Leukotriene-C4 synthase activity and increases the optimum for pH-dependent activity.
